resources.string: Google accounts
Setup cancelled
Setup cancelled
"Only one managed account is allowed for this device. If you have questions, contact your organisation's admin."
Google account
This type of account is managed by your organisation.
Type the text that you see here:
Go back

To add the account to this device, first install ^1".
^1 helps you set up this device for your child."
Adding this account requires device management. Would you like to start afresh with a different account?
"To access your work account on this device, you'll need to set a lock screen. This is your organisation's mobile device policy."
This account requires Screen Lock security. Would you like to start again with a different account?

"Your work profile keeps your work apps separate and is managed by your organisation.
To finish setup, you’ll need a code from your IT admin. A management tool will be downloaded and used by your IT admin to manage your work profile."

"Your work profile keeps your work apps separate and is managed by your organisation.
A management tool will be downloaded and used by your IT admin to manage your work profile."

To add the account to this device, use ^1".
^1 helps you set up this device for your child."

To add the account to this device, first install the latest version of ^1".
^1 helps you set up this device for your child."
" "^1" doesn't use Gmail."
To access your account, you must sign in online. Tap Next to start browser sign in.
This device has been set up to be managed by your organisation.
Your device was factory reset. You can unlock it with your previous secret.
"This account couldn't be accessed. Make sure that your device is following your organisation's security policies. If you keep seeing this error, contact your organisation's admin."
" Your domain requires mobile device management. Install the \"Google Apps Device Policy\" app to enforce the security policies required by the "^1 account.
" "^1" can contain only letters, numbers and full stops."
" "^1" doesn't contain any letters."
" "^1 contains fewer than 6 or more than 30 characters.
The username ^1" isn't available."
" The account "^1 must be added to a device or work profile administered by your organisation. Please follow the instructions provided by your IT admin in order to complete this.
Invalid character. Only 0-9, a-z, A-Z and full stops are allowed.
"The text you have typed isn't a valid username."
You typed an incorrect password or your account has changed. Re-type your password. If you forgot your password and need to recover your account click here.
This could be a temporary problem or your Android device may not be provisioned for data services. Try again when connected to a mobile network or connect to a Wi-Fi network.
"If you forget your password or you're signing in from a new device or location, you may be asked for one or both of these codes to help protect your Google account."
"These codes expire 15 minutes from now or after they're used. You should only use them on web pages with URLs that start with 'https://accounts.google.com/'."

After resetting, you may need to sign in to your %1$s" Google Account.
"Review backup status to make sure that you can restore your data later.
Retype password
Start Again
Account added
By signing in, you agree to the Google and Additional Privacy Policies.
Sign in with your Google account:
Sign in
Account set up

Users who purchased this device:" The device manufacturer has preloaded Google apps and services without certification from Google. Contact the manufacturer and ask for a certified device. Learn more at g.co/AndroidCertifiedDevice.
"Unlicensed manufacturers:" You need a licence from Google to distribute Google apps and services. Apply at g.co/AndroidGMSContact.
"Licensed manufacturers:" To use Google apps and services during development, register the device. Contact your Google Business Development Manager for more info.
"Custom ROM users:" To use Google apps and services with a custom ROM, register this device. Learn more at g.co/AndroidDeviceRegistration."
Authorisation dialogue
Add an account.
Apps connected

Get started.

Find out more

No, thanks

Terms of service
"Your Android device isn't connected to a Wi-Fi network. To view this information now, visit %s via a web browser."
Please log in
Credentials granted. Proceed to log in on your first device.
"Press and hold the button on your key for at least 5 seconds to make sure that it's in pairing mode"
Pairing your Security Key...
Pair your key to this device so that you can use it with your account
From the list below select the Security Key that you wish to pair with your device. The name may be printed on the back of the key.
An error has occurred
Sign-in requests from nearby devices
Verifying your Security Key...
Security Keys work with Bluetooth, NFC and USB. Choose how you want to use your key.
"Confirm your fingerprint so %1$s can verify that it's you."
Fingerprint not recognised. Try again
Fingerprint recognised
Telephone
Body sensors
This may take a few minutes.

By continuing, you agree that this device may also automatically download and install updates and apps from Google, your operator and your device’s manufacturer, possibly using mobile data. Some of these apps may offer in-app purchases.
To remove apps, go to Settings > Apps or Application manager. Then tap the app that you want to uninstall (you may need to swipe right or left to find the app). Then tap Uninstall or Disable.
You also hereby consent and grant preloaded Google apps permission to access information and functions on your device. See this page for more information on usage of these permissions.
When your phone storage is almost full, free space by removing data, such as backed-up photos and videos.
Easily restore your data or switch phones at any time. Your backup includes apps, app data and device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords).

"^1
Backup data will not count towards your Drive storage quota."
App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages and photos.
App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including data such as contacts, messages and photos.

"^1
Photos and videos on this device sync to your Google Photos library so that you can search, edit, delete and share from any of your devices. By default, full-resolution photos and videos are uploaded to Google Photos.
Backup data will not count towards your Drive storage quota."
Easily restore your data or switch phones at any time. Your backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts and device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions).
Easily restore your data or switch phones at any time. Your backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts, device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions) and SMS.

"Easily restore your data or switch phones at any time. Your backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts, device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions) and SMS.
Your backups are uploaded to Google and encrypted using your Google Account password. For some data, your device’s screen lock PIN, pattern or password is also used for encryption."

Easily restore your data or switch phones at any time. Your backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts, device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions), photos, videos and SMS. Photos and videos sync to your Google Photos library and may be used across services.

"Easily restore your data or switch phones at any time. Your backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts, device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions), photos, videos and SMS. Photos and videos sync to your Google Photos library and may be used across services.
Your backups are uploaded to Google and encrypted using your Google Account password. For some data, your device’s screen lock PIN, pattern or password is also used for encryption."
Data will be used according to Google’s Privacy Policy.
Data will be used according to Google’s Privacy Policy (including collection, storage and usage of personal information) and the Location Terms of Service.
Tap to find out more about each service, such as how to turn it on or off later. ^1

Use Google’s Location service to help apps determine your location. Google may collect location data periodically and use this data in an anonymous way to improve location accuracy and location-based services.

"Google’s Location service uses sources such as Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors to help estimate your device’s location. This service is active when your device’s Location setting is on, and in a mode that uses Wi‑Fi or mobile networks to estimate location, such as either the High accuracy or Battery saving mode.
You can turn off this service by either:
"
Turning off the main Location setting on your device."
"
Leaving the main Location setting on and selecting a mode that uses GPS only, sometimes called Device only.

"Google’s Location Service uses sources such as Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors to help estimate your device’s location.
You can turn off location by turning off the main location setting on your device. You can also turn off the use of Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors for location in location settings."
"Allow apps and services to scan for Wi‑Fi, even when it's off."
"Tap 'Accept' to confirm your selection of these Google services settings."

"By tapping 'Accept', you agree to the "Google Terms of Service. You also confirm your selection of these Google services settings. Note: The Google Privacy Policy describes how data is handled when using Google services.
"By tapping 'Accept', you confirm your selection of these Google services settings. Note: The "Google Privacy Policy describes how data is handled when using Google services.

Help improve your Android experience by automatically sending diagnostic, device and app usage data to Google. This will help battery life, system and app stability and other improvements. Some aggregate data will also help Google apps and partners, such as Android developers. If your additional Web & App Activity setting is turned on, this data may be saved to your Google Account.

"This is general information about your device and how you use it (such as battery level, system and app activity and errors). The data will be used to improve Android, and some aggregated information will also help Google apps and partners, such as Android developers, make their apps and products better.
Turning off this feature doesn’t affect your device’s ability to send the information needed for essential services such as system updates and security."
If your additional Web & App Activity setting is turned on, this data may be saved to your Google Account. You can see your data, delete it and change your account settings at account.google.co
Allow Google Live wallpapers to respond to your location by accessing Google’s Location Service.

You can turn access to Google’s Location Service for live wallpapers on or off by going to Settings > Apps & notifications > App info. In the overflow menu, tap Show system > Live data wallpapers or Live Earth Wallpapers > Permissions.

By continuing, you agree that this device may also automatically download and install updates and apps from Google, your operator and this device’s manufacturer, possibly using mobile data. Some of these apps may offer in-app purchases.
Easily restore data or switch phones at any time. This backup includes apps, app data and device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords).

"^1
Backup data will not count towards your child’s Drive storage quota."

"^1
Photos and videos on this device sync to your child’s Google Photos library so that your child can search, edit, delete and share from any of their devices. By default, full-resolution photos and videos are uploaded to Google Photos.
Backup data will not count towards your child’s Drive storage quota."
Easily restore data or switch phones at any time. This backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts and device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions).
Easily restore data or switch phones at any time. This backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts, device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions) and SMS.

"Easily restore data or switch phones at any time. This backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts, device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions) and SMS.
Backups are uploaded to Google and encrypted using your child’s Google Account password. For some data, the device’s screen lock PIN, pattern or password is also used for encryption."

Easily restore data or switch phones at any time. This backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts, device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions), photos, videos and SMS. Photos and videos sync to your child’s Google Photos library and may be used across services.

"Easily restore data or switch phones at any time. This backup includes apps, app data, call history, contacts, device settings (including Wi‑Fi passwords and permissions), photos, videos and SMS. Photos and videos sync to your child’s Google Photos library and may be used across services.
Backups are uploaded to Google and encrypted using your child’s Google Account password. For some data, the device’s screen lock PIN, pattern or password is also used for encryption."

Use Google’s Location service to help apps determine this device’s location. Google may collect location data periodically and use this data in an anonymous way to improve location accuracy and location-based services.

"Google’s Location service uses sources like Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors to help estimate this device’s location. This service is active when this device’s Location setting is on, and in a mode that uses Wi‑Fi or mobile networks to estimate location, such as either the High accuracy or Battery saving mode.
You can turn off this service by either:
"
Turning off the main Location setting on this device."
"
Leaving the main Location setting on and selecting a mode that uses GPS only, sometimes called Device only.

"Google’s Location Service uses sources such as Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors to help estimate this device’s location.
You can turn off location by turning off the main location setting on this device. You can also turn off the use of Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and sensors for location in location settings."

Help improve the Android experience by automatically sending diagnostic, device and app usage data to Google. This won’t be used to identify your child and will help battery life, system and app stability and other improvements. Some aggregate data will also help Google apps and partners, such as Android developers. If additional Web & App Activity is turned on for your child, this data may be saved to their Google Account.

"This is general information about this device and how it’s used (such as battery level, system and app activity and errors). The data will be used to improve Android, and some aggregated information will also help Google apps and partners, such as Android developers, make their apps and products better.
Turning off this feature doesn’t affect this device’s ability to send the information needed for essential services such as system updates and security."

On your other device:

1. Open the Google Settings app

2. Select %1$s

3. Touch %2$s on the list and follow the on-screen instructions
"Don't skip"
"Setup won't copy this account or backed-up apps and data to this device."
"To set up your other device, your phone's Bluetooth will be turned on, if not on already"
Tap Sign in to finish signing in to another device.
This extra step helps to make sure that this is a secure device.
Only open networks and WPA/WPA2 networks can be used to set up this device
"Can't Search for Wi-Fi Networks"

"To search for networks, Wi-Fi and location need to be turned on, if not on already.
You can always change this later in Settings."
"%1$s needs to verify that it's you."
